semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Patients Receiving Preoperative Evaluations Only
section_path: Section IV > Diagnostic Coding and Reporting Guidelines for Outpatient Services > M. Patients receiving preoperative evaluations only

content.full_text: For patients receiving preoperative evaluations only, sequence first a code from subcategory Z01.81, Encounter for pre-procedural examinations, to describe the pre-op consultations. Assign a code for the condition to describe the reason for the surgery as an additional diagnosis. Code also any findings related to the pre-op evaluation. (Evidence: pg no: 115, L22-L23)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding preoperative evaluation encounters with specific sequencing requirements using Z01.81 codes (Evidence: pg no: 115, L22-L23)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Sequence first a code from subcategory Z01.81 for preoperative evaluations (Evidence: pg no: 115, L22-L23)
detailed_rules.explanation: When encounter is solely for preoperative evaluation, the Z01.81 code takes priority in sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 115, L22-L23)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign code for condition requiring surgery as additional diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 115, L23)
detailed_rules.explanation: The underlying condition that necessitates the surgery should be coded as secondary diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 115, L23)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code any findings related to the pre-op evaluation (Evidence: pg no: 115, L23)
detailed_rules.explanation: Additional findings discovered during preoperative evaluation should also be coded (Evidence: pg no: 115, L23)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify encounter as preoperative evaluation only
